page.title: 06Bonneyhale Mushroom Farm
page.content: The prepared palettes are kept in the growing rooms for approx.3 weeks.The air must be circulated so hot air is drawn out from the top and pumped back in again at the bottom.This stops carbon dioxide forming which would prevent the mycelia fruiting.The out- sides of the growing sheds are covered in black plastic to draw in heat. Inside it is covered with a double thickness of insulation and finished off with a white plastic to reflect heat and light.The mushrooms have a six week cycle consisting of four 'breaks'or'flushes'.The men pick the first break,and pack them into cardboard baskets called'chips' which hold 1.361kg.Between breaks the compost is watered.There are 3 to 4 days between each break.The mushrooms are mainly sold to wholesale markets in Doncaster,Hull and Bradford.
